did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Documents, videos, and film from Phil Zwickler's work on "Rights and Reactions," as well as several other projects, including some material regarding "Fear of Disclosure," and miscellaneous files and photographs, mostly from 1987 to 1992.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Filmmaker and writer about gay and lesbian issues and the AIDS crisis, born June 1, 1954 and died from the complications of AIDS on May 7, 1991. With Jane Lippman, he produced and directed "Rights and Reactions: Lesbian and Gay Rights on Trial," an award-winning documentary covering the 1986 New York City Council hearings on the gay rights bill. Zwickler collaborated with David Wojnarowicz to produce "Fear of Disclosure," a short film about the issues gay men face dating in the context of AIDS. Zwickler also worked with experimental German film maker, Rosa von Praunheim, to produce "Silence Equals Death" and "Positive," both exploring the emotions and anger of people with AIDS. The film "Positive" includes interviews with Zwickler and two other men who were HIV-positive. He produced his final project, "The Needle Nightmares" (1991), with the help of David Meieran. Zwickler also worked as a news reporter, publishing stories in the Village Voice and serving as editor of the People with AIDS Coalition Newsline for a number of years. Before working in film and journalism, he taught literature in New York City public schools and community colleges.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Documents, publicity, funding proposals, correspondence, production notes, and video outtakes from Phil Zwickler's work on "Rights and Reactions," as well as several other documentary and video projects, including "Fear of Disclosure," "Silence = Death," and "Positive." Also, documentation of his work as editor for "PWA Coalition Newsline," and miscellaneous files and photographs, mostly from 1987 to 1992.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:

p.emph: 29 tape recordings that are part of the "Rights and Reactions" project may only be screened or viewed for research, scientific, or scholarly purposes. Any and all uses other than the aforementioned are expressly prohibited. No duplication, sale, rental, broadcast, or public screening is authorized.

userestrict.p: Archival copies of videos are not to be played. This includes originals and preservation copies. Use copies exist for many titles. If there is not a use copy, the researcher can request that one be made.

altformavail.head: Available Copies:
altformavail.p: Use copies are available for selected films and videos.
Note:Tapes designated as 3/4"* are 3/4" wide but shorter than regular 3/4" tapes. They can still be viewed using the 3/4" U Matic machine.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Phil Zwickler papers, #7564. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
